site_name: Land To The South Side Of Park Avenue
description: The formation of a vehicular access and road to the railway tracks; installation of lighting, a fence and gate
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:  application covering letter including Appendix A: Supporting planning statement document reference CCM2A_CNS_STA_NCA_000004 dated 10 August 2020 as prepared by Akshat Vipin, Town Planner, Network Rail; Acoustics Noise Impact Assessment,  RRAP Access, Revision 02 dated 4 August 2020 as prepared by Hoare Lea; Arboricultural Report, Revision B dated 22 January 2021 document reference 408093_MM_MP_AR_RP_002 A as prepared by Mott MacDonald; Transport Technical Note dated 6 August 2020 as prepared by WSP; Ecological Impact Assessment, Revision 00 dated 4 August 2020 document reference 408093SP08 00 as prepared by Mott MacDonald; Preliminary Risk Assessment document reference 70054595_PRA dated August 2020 as prepared by WSP; drawing numbers 160876_NRD_DRG_ECV_000002 Revision A03 as prepared by Design Delivery on behalf of Network Rail; 160876_NRD_DRG_ECV_000001B_Planning Revision A03 as prepared by Design Delivery on behalf of Network Rail; SHS_ASA_ZZ_ZZ_DR_A_0106 Revision P01 as prepared by Assael;  SHS_ASA_ZZ_ZZ_DR_A_0103 Revision P03 as prepared by Assael;  160876_NRD_DRG_ECV_000001 Revision A03 as prepared by Design Delivery on behalf of Network Rail; 160876_NRD_DRG_ECV_000001A Planning Revision A02 as prepared by Design Delivery on behalf of Network Rail; and document reference CCM2A_CNS_DRG_NCA_000001 A01 as prepared by Assael;
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| Prior to commencement of development (excluding site enabling works), details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of gate posts and gates to be installed with proprietary anti-vibration isolators to prevent structural or airborne vibration noise being transmitted to noise sensitive premises and the closing mechanism shall be buffered to adequately silence the operation of the gates.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration or noise, in accordance with Policy 1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 DPD, 2012; Policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document, 2013; Policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Ealing Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.

| Prior to commencement of development (excluding site enabling works), details of external artificial lighting shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing.  Lighting contours shall be submitted to demonstrate that the vertical illumination of neighbouring premises is in accordance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Professionals in the 'Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light'.  Details should also be submitted for approval of measures to minimise the use/hours of lighting and prevent glare and sky glow by correctly using, locating, aiming and shielding luminaires.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to first use of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of residents in accordance with Policies 3.19 and 7.6 of The London Plan, 2016 and Policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013.

| No trees, shrubs or hedges within the site which are shown to be retained on the approved plans (Drawing number 408093-MM-MP-AR-DR-011 Revision P1 as prepared by Mott Macdonald) shall be felled, uprooted, wilfully damaged or destroyed, cut back in any way or removed without previous written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Any shrubs or hedges removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5 years from the completion of the development hereby permitted shall be replaced with shrubs or hedge plants or similar species capable of achieving a comparable size unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

Any trees removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5 years from the completion of the development hereby permitted shall be replaced in accordance with trees, shrubs or hedge plants of similar size and species unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.
Reason: to secure the protection throughout the time that development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within the site which are of amenity value to the area.

| All tree protection methods as detailed in the hereby approved Arboricultural Report, Revision B dated 22 January 2021 document reference 408093_MM_MP_AR_RP_002 A as prepared by Mott MacDonald shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the  site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with Policies 5.10 and 7.21 of the London Plan, 2016; Policy 5.10 of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines.

| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out using the best practical means available in accordance with British Standard Code of Practice BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014 to be employed at all times to minimise the emission of noise and dust from the site; the operation of site equipment and / or plant and machinery generating noise that is audible at the facade of residential or noise sensitive premises shall only be carried out between the hours of 0800 to 1800 Mondays to Fridays, 0800 to 1300 on Saturdays and at no time on Sundays and Bank Holidays unless otherwise agreed by the London Borough of Ealing as the local planning authority.

Reason: In the interests of minimising the impact of noise, vibration and airborne pollution on the amenities of occupiers of properties within the vicinity of the site, to limit the works to reasonable hours and to minimise the impact of construction traffic on the highway network. In accordance with Policies 5.3, 5.18, 6.3, 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016; Policies 1.1(j), 1.1 (K) and 1.2 (f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 DPD, 2012; Ealing's SPG 10: Noise and Vibration; SPG3: Air Quality; The control of dust and emissions during construction and demolition (July 2014); BS 5228-1:2009 + A1.2014 - Code of practice and policy LV5.2 of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD, 2013.

| The development hereby permitted shall include attenuation through permeable paving and attenuation tanks and be based on sustainable drainage principles.  The surface water run-off generated up to and including the 1 in 100 year plus climate change storm will not exceed 5 litres per second.  The surface water drainage scheme shall be implemented and completed prior to first use of the approved development and be retained thereafter.

Reason: To minimise the risk of flooding, to improve and protect water quality, improve habitat and amenity and in the interests of the drainage network in accordance with policies 5.12, 5.13 and 5.14 of the London Plan 2016, policy 1.2(m) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 (2012) and policy LV5.12 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).
